newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean troops exchange fire with infiltrators.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean troops exchange fire with infiltrators.

text.p: South Korean troops exchanged gunfire on Wednesday with suspected North Korean infiltrators who sneaked into the country in a small submarine, Yonhap television reported.
The television said the clash occurred on a hill near the eastern city of Kangung. It gave no further details.
A Defence Ministry spokesman said he could not confirm the report.
Earlier, the spokesman said troops and helicopters were hunting for suspected North Korean infiltrators after a submarine was found grounded off a beach near the border with North Korea.
State television quoted witnesses as saying five or six men dressed in military uniforms had been heading inland.
